column4: Last friday I switched my desktop from Ubuntu 10 LTS to 12 LTS

just because a new kernel is available, does not mean you have to use it. servers that are left on for years on end don't get their kernels updated (they are working on a fix for this though, I think fedora is experimenting with it)
how can I exclude a kernel update when using the command "aptitude safe-upgrade"
I don't use the GUI updater, but I believe there is a simple checkbox. alternatively, you can install the new kernel and just not reboot, the old kernel will be left in until then
